name: vscode-pylance-workspace-folder-scope
description: Scopes Pylance analysis to each workspace folder and auto-disables it if a folder exceeds a file-count threshold.

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.enable.description: Enable per-folder scoping and auto-disable when over threshold.

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.maxFiles.description: If a workspace folder contains more than this many .py files, Pylance analysis will be disabled for that folder.

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.includeDirs.description: Directories or glob-like entries to include when analysis is enabled. Each entry will be treated as a root and expanded to Python files. Examples: "./", "src", "packages/*".

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.excludeDirs.description: Directory names to skip when counting Python files and to exclude when analysis is enabled.

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.notification.description: Controls how notifications are shown: pop-up toasts, a status bar indicator, Problems panel diagnostics, or no notifications.

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.showEnableTo.description: Show a toast when Pylance is re-enabled for a folder. Only used when notificationMode is 'toast'.

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.showDisableT.description: Show a toast when Pylance is disabled for a folder. Only used when notificationMode is 'toast'.

pylanceWorkspaceFolderScope.toastSuppres.description: Minimum minutes between repeated toasts for the same folder. 0 means no throttling.
